dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: A new satellite internet pilot project in Kyrgyzstan, signed just this past November 4th.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A new satellite internet pilot project in Kyrgyzstan, signed just this past November fourth.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: At the official ceremony holding on October 4, 2018, the Ministry of information and communications of Republic of Kazakhstan, Transtelecom JSC, the consortium SilkNetCom LLP, and Kazakhtelecom JSC have signed the PPP agreement for the project named Providing broadband access to rural areas of the Republic of Kazakhstan using the technology of fiber-optical communication lines.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, right, with Transtelecom LLC and KazakhTelekom Inc. involved. That's a pretty quick six-month trial, isn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, right, with Transtelecom L L C and KazakhTelekom Inc. involved. That's a pretty quick six-month trial, isn't it?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The project realization period is expected to be 13 years. Transtelecom JSC, the consortium SilkNetCom LLP, and Kazakhtelecom JSC have signed the PPP agreement for the project named Providing broadband access to rural areas of the Republic of Kazakhstan using the technology of fiber-optical communication lines.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and the CFO Svetlana Petrova was there representing Transtelecom. They're focusing on urban areas first—students, businesses, public servants.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and the C F O Svetlana Petrova was there representing Transtelecom. They're focusing on urban areas first-students, businesses, public servants.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Zhanbolat Nadyrov, CEO of Transtelecom JSC, represented the company. The project named Providing broadband access to rural areas of the Republic of Kazakhstan using the technology of fiber-optical communication lines.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Mhm, she mentioned how public servants could cooperate better with other bodies. But uh, the text also points out it might worsen digital illiteracy in the short term?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Mhm, she mentioned how public servants could cooperate better with other bodies. But uh, the text also points out it might worsen digital illiteracy in the short term?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Digital literacy level improvement and e-Commerce development will impact positively on Kazakhstan economy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly, which is kind of ironic for an internet project. But they're laying 600km of satellite comms wire to serve 10 urban settlements and 200 schools and government buildings.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly, which is kind of ironic for an internet project. But they're laying six hundred kilometers of satellite comms wire to serve ten urban settlements and two hundred schools and government buildings.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Thus, within the framework of the project, TTC will conduct 6,000 km of fiber-optic communication wires along the railways, which will provide 421 rural settlements and 1222 local schools, hospitals, local state bodies, police stations and other institutions with the Internet access at a high speed of 20 Mbit/s.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: At 2Mbit/s though—that's not exactly blazing fast by today's standards, is it? They called it "very unstable Internet access" too, which is… honest.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: At two megabits per second though-that's not exactly blazing fast by today's standards, is it? They called it very unstable Internet access too, which is... honest.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Thus, within the framework of the project, TTC will conduct 6,000 km of fiber-optic communication wires along the railways, which will provide 421 rural settlements and 1222 local schools, hospitals, local state bodies, police stations and other institutions with the Internet access at a high speed of 20 Mbit/s.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, but it's a start. And they plan to expand to villages and more state bodies next year. Petrova said this fiber-optic setup will support future projects like Smart schools and telemedicine.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, but it's a start. And they plan to expand to villages and more state bodies next year. Petrova said this fiber-optic setup will support future projects like Smart schools and telemedicine.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It was reported that already this year, TTC will provide 48 villages and 150 local state bodies with Internet access. Zhanbolat Nadyrov also added that the project will be implemented with the long term prospects, so the fiber-optic infrastructure will become as the foundation for a number of future projects such as Smart schools, telemedicine and safe city.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which sounds promising, but Transtelecom is one of the smallest operators there, specializing in very expensive services. I wonder about the long-term affordability.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which sounds promising, but Transtelecom is one of the smallest operators there, specializing in very expensive services. I wonder about the long-term affordability.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Transtelecom JSC is one of the largest communication operators in the Republic of Kazakhstan that specialize in provision of a wide range of telecommunication services, digitalization and system integration in the field of IT, communications, automation and energy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. It feels like a step forward, but with some clear limitations and maybe unintended side effects.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. It feels like a step forward, but with some clear limitations and maybe unintended side effects.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely a mixed bag. Let's see how that six-month trial actually goes.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely a mixed bag. Let's see how that six-month trial actually goes.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The project realization period is expected to be 13 years.

artist_script:
HostA: A new satellite internet pilot project in Kyrgyzstan, signed just this past November 4th.
HostB: Oh, right, with Transtelecom LLC and KazakhTelekom Inc. involved. That’s a pretty quick six-month trial, isn’t it?
HostA: Yeah, and the CFO Svetlana Petrova was there representing Transtelecom. They’re focusing on urban areas first—students, businesses, public servants.
HostB: Mhm, she mentioned how public servants could cooperate better with other bodies. But uh, the text also points out it might worsen digital illiteracy in the short term?
HostA: Exactly, which is kind of ironic for an internet project. But they’re laying 600km of satellite comms wire to serve 10 urban settlements and 200 schools and government buildings.
HostB: At 2Mbit/s though—that’s not exactly blazing fast by today’s standards, is it? They called it “very unstable Internet access” too, which is… honest.
HostA: Right, but it’s a start. And they plan to expand to villages and more state bodies next year. Petrova said this fiber-optic setup will support future projects like Smart schools and telemedicine.
HostB: Which sounds promising, but Transtelecom is one of the smallest operators there, specializing in very expensive services. I wonder about the long-term affordability.
HostA: For sure. It feels like a step forward, but with some clear limitations and maybe unintended side effects.
HostB: Definitely a mixed bag. Let’s see how that six-month trial actually goes.
